gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class PanViewControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.PanViewControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class PanViewControl
extends ViewControl

This view control is used to "pan" an image. Adding a PanViewControl will cause a thumbnail of the image to appear in the control panel.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:

Overrides:

Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

setControlValue

public void setControlValue(java.lang.Object value)
This method will set the local bounds for the PanViewControl. This is the same as calling setLocalBounds() only this method is used for generic getting and setting of values.

Specified by:

enableStretch

public void enableStretch(boolean can_stretch)
Use this method to enable/disable the stretching ability of the viewport.

Parameters:
can_stretch - True to enable stretching, false to disable.

isStretchEnabled

public boolean isStretchEnabled()
Use this method to find out if stretching is enabled.

Returns:
True is enabled, false if disabled.

getLocalBounds

public CoordBounds getLocalBounds()
Get the local bounds of the thumbnail. These bounds represent the area viewable by the user and are shown graphically by the cursor.

Returns:
Bounds of the viewable region.

setLocalBounds

public void setLocalBounds(CoordBounds lb)
Set the local bounds of the thumbnail. These bounds represent the area viewable by the user and are shown graphically by the cursor.

Parameters:
lb - Bounds of the viewable region.

getGlobalBounds

public CoordBounds getGlobalBounds()
Get the global bounds of the thumbnail. These bounds represent the entire possible area viewable by the user.

Returns:
Bounds of the viewable region.

setGlobalBounds

public void setGlobalBounds(CoordBounds gb)
Set the global bounds of the thumbnail. These bounds represent the entire possible area viewable by the user. If the global bounds are changed, the local bounds are reinitialized to the global bounds.

Parameters:
gb - Bounds of the viewable region.

repaint

public void repaint()
This will overload the repaint method. This method calls refreshData()

repaint in class java.awt.Component

Test program...If "cm" is passed as an argument, the ControlManager will link controls.
